item.itunes:subtitle: Investing in an edible garden could also be an investment in your health
item.description:
Plant-based Diets, Health and Planting — Investing in an edible garden could also be an investment in your health Angela Schaefer (Functional Medicine Health Coach) Debby Laatz (Prue Leith | Head of Academics) Werner Spohr (Prue Leith | Head Chef) In the time of Covid-19 the world has been reminded that investing in one's health is crucial. With spring in the air, we look at planting edible gardens, not only to increase fruit and vegetable consumption needed for good health, but also for chefs to run more sustainable kitchens. We discuss the requirements for a strong immune system, the reasoning behind eating a rainbow of vegetables and how to plant your own in a kitchen garden. We also talk about the benefits of the trendy plant based diet and share some thoughts on how chefs can shift the balance on plates to focus on vegetables rather than meat.


More about boosting the immune system as well as a link to the Phytonutrient Spectrum that is mentioned in the podcast. https://www.prueleith.co.za/news/eat-your-colours-to-boost-the-immune-system/

item.itunes:title: Covid-19 — The impact on food | Anna Trapido (PhD in Anthropology, Food Writer and Chef)
item.itunes:subtitle: How a virus is changing the way we eat and drink
item.description:
In this episode we talk Covid-19. The virus that is not only threatened our lives, but also our livelihoods, especially in the hospitality industry. Host Adele Stiehler-van der Westhuizen talks to Prue Leith alumna, Food Anthropologist and food writer Anna Trapido about the impact of the virus on the food system. They also discuss the prognosis for restaurants, post Covid-19, and how people in general interact with food during this time of crisis.

item.title: Talking food, health and hospitality | Prue Leith CBE (Prue Leith Culinary Institute | Patron)
item.itunes:title: Talking food, health and hospitality | Prue Leith CBE (Prue Leith Culinary Institute | Patron)
item.itunes:subtitle: As she turns 80, Prue shares her lifetime in food, media and hospitality
item.description:
In this episode Prue Leith, CBE, the patron of the Prue Leith Culinary Institute in South Africa, talks to Adele Stiehler-van der Westhuizen shortly before her 80th birthday. Prue shares fond memories as she looks back at a lifetime in food, media and hospitality and gives some advice to those who consider a career in food. The conversation starts with Prue's looking back at some of her fondest moments including some of her biggest cooking blunders, but extends to serious conversations about sustainability, the future of food, meat consumption, healthy eating and her latest book, The Vegetarian Kitchen.


Learn more about Prue Leith, CBE, on her website https://prue-leith.com/
